title: 'I think we can do it' - Dyche confident of Everton escape
description: Everton suffered a chastening 4-1 home defeat by Newcastle to leave them second bottom and two points off safety, but Sean Dyche is confident his side can survive.

title: Everton 1-4 Newcastle: Sean Dyche bemoans 'soft' Toffees after Newcastle defeat
description: Everton boss Sean Dyche says his side were "soft" in the basic principles of defending during the 4-1 defeat against Newcastle at Goodison Park.

title: Simona Halep doping case: Wimbledon 2019 champion frustrated but 'process ongoing'
description: Former Wimbledon champion Simona Halep, who denies taking a banned substance, says she is frustrated by waiting for her doping case to be resolved.

title: Tottenham Hotspur 2-2 Manchester United: Spurs come from 2-0 down to draw
description: Son Heung-min scores a 79th-minute equaliser to complete a fine Tottenham comeback against Manchester United in Ryan Mason's first game back as interim boss.

title: Charles Leclerc: Ferrari driver fuels Mercedes speculation with 'not yet' denial
description: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc insists he has not had talks with Mercedes - but fuels claims of a potential move by adding "not yet".

title: MP Julian Knight faces fresh misconduct allegations, BBC is told
description: Julian Knight strongly denies any wrongdoing, after police dropped an investigation into him.

title: Police could be missing homicides - watchdog
description: The force has not learned from mistakes in the case of serial killer Stephen Port, a report says.

title: Southampton 0-1 Bournemouth: Marcus Tavernier goal pushes Saints closer to relegation
description: Bournemouth move closer to Premier League survival and push Southampton towards relegation with an impressive victory at St Mary's.

title: Everton 1-4 Newcastle United: Callum Wilson scores twice for third-placed side at struggling Toffees
description: Third-placed Newcastle take a huge stride towards Champions League football next season with victory at Everton, who remain rooted in the Premier League's relegation zone.

title: Sudan crisis: Ceasefire extended but fighting continues
description: The warring sides agree to renew the truce just before it is due to end but there are doubts it can hold.

title: New police powers to tackle slow-walking protests
description: Just Stop Oil and Extinction Rebellion have used the tactic to bring traffic to a standstill.

title: Chelsea 'closing gap' on elite clubs despite European exit, says manager Emma Hayes
description: Chelsea's wait for a first Women's Champions League trophy goes on following defeat to Barcelona, but manager Emma Hayes believes the "gap is closing" on Europe's elite.

title: Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell pranked by Russians
description: Federal Reserve chairman Jerome Powell is the latest personality to be pranked by comedians.

title: Marelle Sturrock: Man's body found after murder of pregnant teacher
description: Police believe it is David Yates, 36, the partner of Marelle Sturrock who was found dead on Tuesday.

title: Hugh Grant accuses Sun publisher of 'deliberate false denials'
description: The actor alleges that the paper commissioned private investigators to break into his home.

title: Benhall stabbing: Boy detained for life after girl left paralysed
description: The 16-year-old victim is left mostly paralysed from the neck down following the attack in Suffolk.

title: Madrid Open: Andy Murray loses to Andrea Vavassori, Kyle Edmund beaten by Dominic Thiem
description: British former world number one Andy Murray is beaten 6-2 7-6 (9-7) by Italian world number 164 Andrea Vavassori at the Madrid Open.

title: Rail strike on 13 May, day of Eurovision final
description: The rail union rejects train firm proposals and will launch strike action on 13 May.

title: Jerry Springer: Cat fights and food fights, the highs and lows of the Jerry Springer Show
description: A look back at some of the sensational shows that made Jerry Springer must watch TV.

title: Sudan evacuation: 'The kids were clinging to me, but I had to leave'
description: Wafaa Salim says it was "horrible" having to leave her nieces and nephews behind in Sudan.

title: Madrid Open: Mirra Andreeva, 15, beats Beatriz Haddad Maia to continue stunning run
description: Russian teenager Mirra Andreeva, 15, reaches the third round of the Madrid Open after beating world number 14 Beatriz Haddad Maia.

title: Tottenham Hotspur: Highs and lows of Spurs' tumultuous season
description: BBC Sport looks at the ups and downs of Tottenham Hotspur's tumultuous 2022-23 season.

title: Sudan crisis: Three ways the conflict could play out
description: The BBC speaks to analysts to help map out the scenarios that may unfold in the next few weeks.

title: Max Verstappen: Red Bull driver questions if Formula 1 is 'actually a good life'
description: Two-time champion Max Verstappen questions if Formula 1's busy schedule is worth it and considers his future in the sport.

title: William and Kate abseil in national park with mountain rescuers
description: The couple arrived near Merthyr Tydfil to wet and windy weather in hiking gear.

title: Sainsbury's and Unilever deny prices are too high
description: The supermarket and Marmite-maker reject suggestions they are not protecting customers from inflation.

title: Ukraine war: Partisan attack kills police chief in Russian-occupied Melitopol
description: Oleksandr Mishchenko died in an explosion outside his apartment block in the city of Melitopol.

title: World Snooker Championship 2023: Si Jiahui opens up a 5-3 lead over Luca Brecel in Sheffield
description: Chinese debut Si Jiahui opens up a 5-3 lead over Belgium's Luca Brecel in an enthralling start to their World Championship semi-final in Sheffield.

title: Whorlton Hall: Four guilty of ill-treating secure unit patients
description: Four former Whorlton Hall workers are convicted of ill-treating patients while five are cleared.

title: Marelle Sturrock: Pregnant teacher's partner wanted in murder probe
description: Primary school teacher Marelle Sturrock. 35, was found dead at a property in Glasgow on Tuesday.

title: Anglo-Saxon coins: Illegally held hoard rewrites English history
description: Anglo-Saxon coins, taken from an undeclared Viking hoard, were touted to international collectors.

title: Jerry Springer: Era-defining TV host dies aged 79
description: The controversial presenter hosted The Jerry Springer Show for nearly three decades from 1991.

title: NFL draft 2023: Bryce Young favourite to be first overall pick by Carolina Panthers
description: BBC Sport highlights five things to look out for in this year's NFL draft, when teams make or break the dreams of thousands of young hopefuls.

title: Sudan: Are there 'safe and legal' routes to come to the UK?
description: Immigration minister Robert Jenrick wrongly said the UN could help Sudanese refugees come to the UK.

title: Azerbaijan Grand Prix: Max Verstappen says new sprint format could make race more chaotic
description: Max Verstappen says the new sprint-race format will make the Azerbaijan Grand Prix "a little more chaotic".

title: Kenyan exonerated over UK tourist David Tebbutt's murder
description: Wife of murdered David Tebbutt says she is "overjoyed" after backing campaign to free Ali Kololo.

title: Richard Sharp: Report on appointment of BBC chairman expected
description: Questions were raised about Richard Sharp's role in securing a loan for the then PM Boris Johnson.

title: England's teachers' strike causes more disruption
description: Teachers are on picket lines in the National Education Union's fourth national strike day in England.

title: Climate change: Spain braced for record April temperatures
description: Temperatures could exceed 38C in southern Spain today as an influx of heat from Africa brings summer early.

title: Gough Island: Worker sought for one of world's remotest places
description: Reaching Gough Island, a British territory, involves a seven-day boat ride from South Africa.

title: Lucy Letby trial: Nurse cries as interview excerpts read in court
description: Excerpts of Lucy Letby's interviews with Cheshire Police after her arrest are heard at her trial.

title: Court orders nurse strike in England to be cut short
description: The Royal College of Nursing's planned 48-hour walkout must now end on Monday instead of Tuesday.

title: Caesareans likely source of herpes, deaths inquest told
description: Kim Sampson and Samantha Mulcahy died after giving birth in two East Kent NHS Trust hospitals.

title: Turner Prize 2023: Windrush and Covid pandemic inspires nominees
description: Barbara Walker, Rory Pilgrim, Ghislaine Leung and Jesse Darling are shortlisted for the art award.

title: Levi Bellfield makes double murder confession
description: Levi Bellfield signs a statement in which he admits killing Lin and Megan Russell, his lawyer says.

title: Royle Family actor Peter Martin dies aged 82
description: Tributes are paid to Mr Martin, from Gainsborough, who also appeared in Emmerdale and Brassed Off.

title: James Corden's Late Late Show writer teases One Direction surprise
description: The final Late Late Show won't feature a One Direction reunion - but fans can expect an "Easter egg".

title: First pictures inside Jenners after fatal fire
description: The building has now been handed back to the owner following a police investigation into the blaze.

title: Train drivers to strike again on FA Cup final day
description: Union Aslef announces three fresh strike days after bosses rejected a 4% pay offer from train firms.

title: Ashes 2023: Australia trying 'Bazball' will help England - Stuart Broad
description: Stuart Broad says "it would be great" if Australia try to mirror England's 'Bazball' tactics during this summer's Ashes series.

title: Football great Pelé enters dictionary as synonym for 'unique'
description: The football legend's name is added to a Brazilian dictionary as an adjective meaning "exceptional".

title: China: History textbook's 'Covid war' mention sparks discussion
description: Some are asking whether a textbook's short description of China's fight against Covid is truthful.

title: From the Ashes: Glenn McGrath on what happened after his 2005 injury at Edgbaston
description: Glenn McGrath's freak injury before the second Test of 2005 is etched into Ashes lore, but standing on a stray cricket ball was only the beginning of the story.

title: Thai woman accused of murdering 12 friends in cyanide poisonings
description: Police say Sararat Rangsiwuthaporn is suspected to have poisoned at least 13 people since 2020.

title: Ted Lasso's Colin: My nan recorded my audition that got me the role
description: Billy Harris, who plays Colin Hughes, talks about his real-life football skills from his self-tape.

title: South Korean president Yoon Suk-yeol sings American Pie at state dinner
description: Yoon Suk-yeol is invited by the US president to sing after a White House state dinner.

title: Do you need to be from London to be a cockney?
description: Cockney status used to be defined by geography. Can people who aren't even Londoners now claim it?

title: Freddie Mercury's 'shortest, tightest' leather shorts sell for £18,000
description: The Queen singer wore the shorts on stage in 1980 "to try to shock the audience", a biographer says.

title: BP faces rebel shareholders over weakening of climate goals
description: The UK's major pension firms vote against BP's chair after the company cut its climate ambitions.

title: New CBI boss says she raised sexual harassment concerns
description: Rain Newton-Smith says she "acted" whenever she had seen sexual harassment at the CBI business group.

title: Sudan: No guarantee of flights after ceasefire, warns foreign secretary
description: The government warns it cannot be sure there will be any more airlifts after a ceasefire ends on Thursday night.

title: Ukraine war: Bakhmut defenders worry about losing support
description: Ukraine is running low on ammunition just as it prepares for a counter offensive against Russia.

title: Gambling white paper: Government to unveil shake-up of laws
description: Culture secretary Lucy Frazer will lay out new restrictions from the government on gambling.

title: Jack Teixeira: Prosecutors say airman poses ongoing national security risk
description: Federal prosecutors want Jack Teixeira to remain in jail while he awaits trial.

title: Watch US police officers save 84-year-old from burning car
description: Dashcam shows the minivan burst into flames after driving with a flat tyre that sent sparks flying.

title: Mason: Sudan evacuation remains a race against time
description: It looks like it will be very difficult to get every Briton out in time before the fighting resumes.

title: Local elections 2023: What do opinion polls suggest?
description: Prof Sir John Curtice considers what the 4 May local elections in England might mean for the prime minister.

title: Pope Francis gives women historic right to vote at meeting
description: The move is being hailed as a "significant crack in the stained glass ceiling" of the Church.

title: Shooting am African TV drama with novices amid real gunfire
description: Director Ahmed Farah was inspired to make the series after hearing young people talk on TikTok.
